title: 115_hr5587
content: The Act may be cited as the "Peer Support Communities of Recovery Act" and focuses on building communities of recovery. The Public Health Service Act is amended to redefine "recovery community organization" as an independent nonprofit organization. The term 'recovery community organization' is redefined as an independent nonprofit organization. An 'eligible entity' is defined as a national nonprofit entity focused on substance use disorder or a nonprofit organization established by individuals in personal or family recovery, serving various stakeholders in the implementation of services. The Secretary may award grants to recovery community organizations and eligible entities for local addiction and recovery initiatives, including establishing regional technical assistance centers. The Secretary may award grants to recovery community organizations and eligible entities for local addiction and recovery initiatives, including establishing regional technical assistance centers. Subsection (c) is amended to specify the use of grants awarded to recovery community organizations. The bill amends subsection (c) to specify the use of grants awarded to recovery community organizations and eligible entities, including the establishment of regional technical assistance centers. The bill establishes regional technical assistance centers to provide support for addiction recovery services and community organizations. The House of Representatives passed a bill allocating $15,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2019 through 2023.
